intro: Peltaea lasiantha, commonly known as the silverleaf peltaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive silver-gray foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Peltaea lasiantha is often found in rocky or well-drained soils, thriving in cooler, high-altitude environments.
